snippet: Contrary to beliefs from a 1968 study, tests show zebra finches can recognize relatives by odor.
abstract: Study co-authored by E Tobias Krause and published in journal Biology Letters finds zebra bird fledglings can recognize their relatives by smell, contradicting longstanding notion that songbirds do not make use of olfaction.
lead_paragraph: Contrary to beliefs from a 1968 study, tests show zebra finches can recognize relatives by odor.

headline.print_headline: In a Surprise, a Songbird Displays a Sense of Smell
headline.seo: Zebra Finches’ Sense of Smell a Songbird Surprise
headline.main: In a Surprise, a Songbird Displays a Sense of Smell
